meanings.definition: To make modern in appearance or style.
meanings.sent1: She modernises her wardrobe by adding trendy accessories.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer modernises old houses with sleek furniture.
meanings.sent3: The fashion show modernises traditional clothing with a futuristic twist.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity modernises the dull office space into a vibrant work environment.
meanings.sent5: The technology company modernises its products to stay ahead of the competition.

meanings.definition: To adapt to modern needs or habits.
meanings.sent1: He modernises his diet by incorporating more plant-based foods.
meanings.sent2: The school modernises its curriculum to include online learning resources.
meanings.sent3: The robot modernises its programming to understand human emotions.
meanings.sent4: Her flexible mindset modernises the way the team approaches challenges.
meanings.sent5: The city modernises its transportation system for a more sustainable future.
